entities.name: Articque
entities.description: Target company in Project INUK. Operates in the Location Intelligence market.

keyInvestmentHighlights: Massive volume of real time location data generated by the ubiquity of smartphones, mobile and business applications
Increasing number of business intelligence and analytics tools supporting location data analysis
Greater interest and awareness from corporations in using location data to accurately identify consumer behavior
Technology maturing with innovative features to be used within organizations
Growing level of criticality assigned to several use cases of location intelligence platforms
Considerable democratization of LI applications shifting from restricted areas for technical experts to becoming accessible by any business user

entities.description: The market for Location Intelligence platforms and solutions, supported by solid drivers.
keyDrivers: Massive volume of real time location data generated by the ubiquity of smartphones, mobile and business applications
Increasing number of business intelligence and analytics tools supporting location data analysis
Greater interest and awareness from corporations in using location data to accurately identify consumer behavior
Technology maturing with innovative features to be used within organizations
Growing level of criticality assigned to several use cases of location intelligence platforms
Considerable democratization of LI applications shifting from restricted areas for technical experts to becoming accessible by any business user
entities.sourceOfData: Page text, Forbes (for use case importance)

entities.name: Location Intelligence Platform
entities.description: General category of platforms used for location data analysis in business operations. Adoption is accelerating across industries, driven by various technological and market factors.

entities.name: Commercial GIS software
entities.description: Geographic Information System software. The first commercial versions were launched in the 1980s.

entities.eventName: Launch of first commercial GIS software
entities.description: The launch of the first commercial GIS software in the 1980s marked an early stage in the development of the Location Intelligence field.

entities.name: Smartphones
entities.description: Ubiquitous devices generating massive volumes of real-time location data, a key driver for Location Intelligence Platform adoption.

entities.name: Mobile applications
entities.description: Applications on mobile devices generating massive volumes of real-time location data, contributing to Location Intelligence.

entities.name: Business applications
entities.description: Applications used in businesses that generate or utilize location data, contributing to Location Intelligence.

entities.name: Business intelligence tools
entities.description: Tools that increasingly support location data analysis, fostering the adoption of Location Intelligence Platforms.

entities.name: Analytics tools
entities.description: Tools that increasingly support location data analysis, fostering the adoption of Location Intelligence Platforms.

entities.name: ChapsVision
entities.description: Company associated with Project INUK, as mentioned in the document footer. Potentially the acquirer or a key partner in the transaction.
